intro: Chlamydanthus, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous perennials that thrive in rocky or arid environments. They are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. Chlamydanthus species are often found in mountainous regions and are adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Their ecological importance includes contributing to soil stabilization and providing nectar for pollinators.
